info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 2 at 12:32AM MDT until July 2 at 2:30AM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Northwestern Luna County in southwestern New Mexico, and nearby areas of Grant County.
* WHEN...Until 230 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1232 AM MDT, A cluster of slow moving thunderstorms is producting torrential rainfall northwest of Deming, particularly along U.S. Highway 180 near Butterfield Trail Estates. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 0.5 to 1 inch is expected over the area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Butterfield Trail Estates. Portions of U.S. Highway 180 between Deming and Hurley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING
